concept.title: Assignment Roles
concept.abstract: Staff users can segment attendees via Assignment Roles in order to identify and analyze levels of customer engagement.

conbody.p: The system automatically creates a Default Attendee Assignment Role, along with Item Classes (Ticket Type Item Class, Schedule Item Item Class, Sponsor Item Class), when creating a new event. If Registration Groups is enabled on the Event record, the system autocreates a Primary Attendee Assignment Role under the Ticket Type Item Class, in addition to the Default Attendee. The Primary Attendee is the primary registrant and the Group Owner, which may or may not be the primary contact for the account. Only authenticated portal users can register a group, so therefore only authenticated portal users can be assigned to the Primary Attendee role. Guest users are not able to initiate group registration.

Assignment Roles identify the Group Owner in the list of assignments. The assignment is integral to building the Attendee records, which relate any session purchases to the contact. In turn, each assignment is linked to the ticket type purchase, and each ticket type must be associated with the beneficiary's contact information, not an actual contact record. Best practices recommend that staff users avoid creating new Assignment Roles for events because the system is configured to identify only the Primary and Default Attendees.
